Pre-Game Insights: A win in the third match will give Sri Lanka their first bilateral ODI series triumph over India in 27 years.
Sri Lanka have a 1-0 lead in the series currently after registering a famous win in the second ODI with the help of their bowlers, following the tied first match.
For India, their batting unit has performed way below par in the series, failing to chase down par totals in two consecutive ODIs.
The pitches at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo for the first two ODIs have provided a lot of assistance to the spin bowlers, making the job of the batters quite difficult in the middle overs.
The average first inning score of 226 in ODI cricket at this venue could end up being very difficult to chase down for either Sri Lanka or India in the series decider.
